meanings.definition: long, slender pieces of wood or metal
meanings.sent1: The carpenter used lanks to build the new bookshelf.
meanings.sent2: The lanks of the fence were painted white.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel used the lanks to create a tiny bridge in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The lanks of sunlight streamed through the window.
meanings.sent5: The old barn was filled with dusty lanks of timber.

meanings.sent1: She admired the lanks palm trees swaying in the breeze.

meanings.sent3: The lanks tower stretched high into the sky, almost touching the clouds.

meanings.definition: to stretch out or extend in a thin, elongated manner
meanings.sent1: He decided to lanks the rubber band to see how far it could go.
meanings.sent2: The cat likes to lanks its body out when it stretches.
meanings.sent3: She tried to lanks the truth to cover up her mistake.
meanings.sent4: The river seemed to lanks endlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The dancer's arms seemed to lanks gracefully as she moved across the stage.
